Registry of Open Data on AWS

Department of Energy's Open Energy Data Initiative (OEDI)

energy environmental geospatial model solar sustainability

Description

Data released under the Department of Energy's Open Energy Data Initiative (DOE). The Open Energy Data Initiative (OEDI) aims to improve and automate access of high-value energy data sets across the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE’s) programs, offices, and national laboratories. OEDI aims to make data actionable and discoverable by researchers and industry to accelerate analysis and advance innovation.

Update Frequency

As needed

Usage Examples

Tools & Applications
  • Tracking the Sun Tool by Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (LBNL)
Publications
  • On the Use of Coupled Wind, Wave, and Current Fields in the Simulation of Loads on BottomSupported Offshore Wind Turbines during Hurricanes by E. Kim, L. Manuel, M. Curcic, S. S. Chen, C. Phillips, P. Veers
  • The Distributed Generation Market Demand Model (dGen):Documentation by B. Sigrin, M. Gleason, R. Preus, I. Baring-Gould, R. Margolis
  • Tracking the Sun Pricing and Design Trends for Distributed Photovoltaic Systems in the United States: 2019 Edition by G. Barbose, N. Darghouth

Resources on AWS

  • Description
    Data Catalog of the Open Energy Data Initiative (OEDI)
    Resource type
    S3 Bucket
    Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
    arn:aws:s3:::oedi-data-lake/
    AWS Region
    us-west-2
    AWS CLI Access (No AWS account required)
    aws s3 ls s3://oedi-data-lake/ --no-sign-request
  • Description
    University of Miami Coupled Model (UMCM) for Hurricanes Ike and Sandy
    Resource type
    S3 Bucket
    Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
    arn:aws:s3:::oedi-data-lake/umcm/
    AWS Region
    us-west-2
    AWS CLI Access (No AWS account required)
    aws s3 ls s3://oedi-data-lake/umcm/ --no-sign-request
  • Description
    HSDS UMCM domains
    Resource type
    S3 Bucket
    Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
    arn:aws:s3:::nrel-pds-hsds/nrel/umcm/
    AWS Region
    us-west-2
    AWS CLI Access (No AWS account required)
    aws s3 ls s3://nrel-pds-hsds/nrel/umcm/ --no-sign-request
  • Description
